meanings.definition: The quality or state of being retractile.
meanings.sent1: The retractilities of the turtle's head allowed it to hide safely in its shell.
meanings.sent2: The retractilities of the fishing rod made it easy to store in a small space.
meanings.sent3: The retractilities of the slinky toy made it amusing to watch as it moved back and forth.
meanings.sent4: The retractilities of the accordion mirror the flexibility of human emotions.
meanings.sent5: The retractilities of the measuring tape made it convenient for the tailor to take accurate measurements.

meanings.definition: The ability to be drawn back or retracted.
meanings.sent1: The retractilities of the telescope allowed astronomers to observe distant stars.
meanings.sent2: The retractilities of the dog's leash made it easy for the owner to control the pet.
meanings.sent3: The retractilities of the vacuum cleaner cord provided entertainment for the playful kitten.
meanings.sent4: The retractilities of a rubber band symbolize the resilience of a person facing challenges.
meanings.sent5: The retractilities of the curtains allowed the sunlight to brighten the room.

meanings.definition: The property of being capable of being pulled or drawn back.
meanings.sent1: The retractilities of the spring-loaded pen made it convenient for quick note-taking.
meanings.sent2: The retractilities of the retractable leash ensured the safety of the dog during walks.
meanings.sent3: The retractilities of the yo-yo entertained the children for hours.
meanings.sent4: The retractilities of a rubber band can represent the flexibility needed in problem-solving.
meanings.sent5: The retractilities of the elastic waistband made the pants comfortable for all-day wear.
